alert.note: Alert for Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 3:28AM EST until January 17 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of around 6 inches possible. * WHERE...In New Hampshire, Strafford County. In Maine, Interior York, Central Interior Cumberland, Androscoggin and Kennebec Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Sunday night through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will likely fall heavily early Monday morning. However there is still question as to how quickly it mixes with or changes to rain. This will determine how much snow one gets. At this time there is a 50 percent chance that 6 or more inches fall.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
